These Ships having been built by contract, expressly for government ser-
vice, every care has been taken in their construction, as also in their engines,
to ensure strength and speed, and their accommodations for passengers are
unequalled for elegance 0r comfort.

3.11 that part of the city lying north of 22d-st.,
and east of the 6th Avenue.
prise all that part of the city lying north of 226..
street. and west of the 6th Avenue.
prise as followsz Beginning at the foot of North
Moore-st., N. R, and extending easterly in a.
straight line to the corner Leonard and Church
streets, thence northerly, in a straight line to
the corner of 8th Avenue and 22d-st. e thence
Westerly, along 22d-st. to the North River.
prise as follows 1 Beginning at the corner Leon-
ard and Church sts.. running thence northerly,
in a, straight line to the corner 8th Avenue and
22d-st. to LexingtonAv. t thence easterly, along
22d-st. to Lexington Av. 1 thence southerlyg in
a straight line to the corner Elm and Leonard
streets , and thence westerly, in a straight line
to the corner Church and Leonard streets.

mas Dz'ty, Nevy Yeavs Day, the 4th of July, and general Holidays, appointelghyfnliggeagtastgchggggi ChUSt
& THE INThItEST FOR DISCOUNT in the banks of this city, (with the exception of those hlarked
* whfch are prwzleged to charge seven per cent.) is fixed at Six per Cent. per Annum upon notes or bills not
hawng 60 days to run. Three days of grace are allowed.7 and the discount taken for the same
d EVERYdJ'SILIthORdNOCEIgl'OFFEFED FOR. DISCOUNT must be delivered into the office on the
ay prece mg e ay 0 lscoun enclosed in a. sealed cover t . ' '
the name of the person upon Whose account it is 011'ered,&c. dlrected to the Cash1er, advlslng
* BILLS 0R NOTES LODGED AT THE BANKS FOR COLLECTION, are collected free of eX-
pense. except when protested for non-payment-the person lodging the same pays the charm of protest.

eign vessels permitted by law to enter on the
same terms as vessels of the United States,
Which shall enter, and load, or unload, or make
fast to any Wharf, one cent and a half per ton,
according to the tonnage in the vesselts register
or papers. On all other vessels double that rate.
The fees are payable in forty-eight hours after
the vessel7s arrival, (at the Custom house.) on
penalty of paying double the amount and costs
of suit.

1he New York Hospital, is located at Blooming-
dale, or on One hundred & Seventeenth street.
west of Avenue Tentht seven mileslfrom City
Hall. Ohicers .- Geo. Newbold, Pres. t Robt. I. Mur-
ray, Sec.g John Adams, Treas. It is necessary,
before a. patient can be admitted into the AsyLUM,
that a Lunacy Warrant from any two Justices of
the Peace, or Police Magistrates of this City, is-
sued upon the evidence of two reputable physi-
cians as to the alleged fact of insanity, be pro-
curedt also a permit from one ofthe Asylum Com-
mittee, with whom the payment of the board
(which is always in advance,) must be arranged.

-Marine Hospital & Quarantine Estab-
lelshment, located on Staten Island, was estab-
hshed by an act of the Legislature, in 1820.
The Staten Island Ferry, at the foot of White-
hah street, near the Battery, lands passengers
qulte neer the Hospital t the boats leave the city
several tlmes during the day. F. Campbell Stew-
art, Physician in Chiefe Henry Buswell, .dpothecmy ,'

322 Pearl. The more effectually to carry out the de-
sign 0fthe society, a. clothing store has been open-
ed at 322 Pearl St., where may be found an assort-
ment of garments for seamen and. others. Officerst

Grand street to the Bowery, you are opposite to the desired number, (128.)
